DIALOGUE.SPEECH: Ah, I see you've found my dissertation! Take it with you and give it a read if you like!

POPUP.NARRATION: The handiwork of the runic carpet contest winner! Such intricate workmanship!

POPUP.NARRATION: The work of the winner of the 3D runes contest. Such magnificent beauty!
The robot dog emits a sharp, mechanical bark and follows you around with its tail wagging.

DIALOGUE.SPEECH: Ah, I see you've met Byte!

Unfortunately, he doesn't have many friends. All the tech on board this ship are too advanced for him to interface with.
He seems to really like you though. You can keep him if you like. Just be sure to take good care of him.

POPUP.NARRATION: Today's special: Primordial Soup! Try our chef's latest creation, filled with nutritious organic compounds to nourish your soul!

Seems like someone left a cup of instant chilli crab noodle on the dining table. That stuff is hard to come by in space. Perhaps you should keep it. Never know when you'll need it right? Besides, it's been here so long that whoever left it here probably wouldn't miss it.

SEQUENCE.NARRATION: That's the Keppler-62e, a super-Earth exoplanet. You feel a pang of longing as you stared out at this Earth-like planet, thinking of home. The view sure is magnificent though.

DIALOGUE.SPEECH: Our ship will be orbiting the Kepler-62e until the Grandmasters instruct otherwise. There is a vast concentration of the Source in the vicinity of Kepler-62e, which we are studying.
So unless you have authorisation from either one of the Grandmasters to travel elsewhere, I suggest you go find someone else to bother. Besides, don't you have any training to do?

SEQUENCE.NARRATION: This is the Source Academy ship. You know, the one you're standing in right now.

POPUP.NARRATION: Looks like a scale model of the academy spaceship. Neat! Not sure why she was so excited about it though.

DIALOGUE.SPEECH: Oh hi! Those cookies are addictive aren't they? Here have some more!

POPUP.NARRATION: You now have more Hbebuerq cookies to add to the mounting pile of uneaten ones in your room.

POPUP.NARRATION: Mmm, home made alien cookies flecked with some weird green stuff. Apparently they are a type of berry called Hbebuerq from Scottie's homeworld. It's suppose to be brain food, so, how bad can it be, right?

SEQUENCE.NARRATION: The Source Academy. Humanity's pride and glory founded by the United Order of Physicists back in 13AE. That's back when they thought the Source had something to do with dark matter and can be explained with quantum physics.

Things have changed a lot since then. We still don't really know what it is, but it is something entirely different and seems to operate on its own laws of physics. And now we're learning to manipulate it to achieve amazing feats.
The year is 1101 A.E.
Exponential advances in technology have allowed the human race to traverse light years’ worth of distances in mere hours.
As Earth’s population reached a breaking point, humans began to migrate across the galaxy, colonizing planets once thought inhabitable, as well as making settlements on those with amiable alien life.
To supplement this rapid expansion, large space stations scattered throughout the solar systems begun to emerge, serving as hubs for different human needs.
Nestled deep in the Kepler-62 system, a prestigious facility of learning exists, claiming fame as perhaps the most rigorous inter-galactic educational institute in the universe.
Here, students learn how to harness the power of an invisible force known as the Source, a hidden energy that lets one manipulate the things around them and perform great feats.
Today, you have enrolled in…

DIALOGUE.SPEECH: Whew… That was a long trip. It feels like I was on that shuttle for a thousand years.
I guess this is the Source Academy. It’s much bigger than my high school back on Earth. It’s hard to believe this is a space station.

SEQUENCE.NARRATION: The teleportation bay is empty, as far as you can see.
You must have been one of the last to arrive, but all the shuttle services before this were fully-booked.
If only you hadn’t procrastinated so much…

DIALOGUE.SPEECH: Never mind that!
Now, the e-mail I got last week says I’m supposed to find my dorm room the minute I get here...
Oh hi, you must be our last recruit! Everyone else is already getting settled in.

SEQUENCE.NARRATION: The strange alien voice startles you. You were so preoccupied you hadn't even noticed the telebay's operator. This is your first time meeting an alien in person. You couldn't help but gawk at him, lost for words.

DIALOGUE.SPEECH: If you exit through that door, the elevator will take you up to the hallway. From there you can access the rest of the ship. Follow the sign at the end of the corridor and you'll find the student quarters. Off you go now!
Oh, um, thanks!

SEQUENCE.NARRATION: You hastily make for the door, feeling a little embarassed.
You exit the elevator into a long hallway leading to various rooms. You look around for a sign leading to the student quarters.

DIALOGUE.SPEECH: Ah, there it is! I can't wait to unload my stuff. It's killing my back. I guess I should've packed lighter.

SEQUENCE.NARRATION: After navigating through long hallways and twisty corridors, you find yourself in front of a room inscribed with your full name.

DIALOGUE.SPEECH: Oh, here it is!

SEQUENCE.NARRATION: Sensing your presence via face and voice-recognition, the door opens smoothly...
